title: Initial Launch of Skill w/At Bat Premium Subscription
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup the client app Alexa
AND has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND has launched for the first time
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa and speaks the intent to launch the skill: 
i.e.
'Launch MLB'
'Open MLB'
'Start MLB'
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"Welcome to M.L.B. What team would you like to listen to?"
AND user is able to speak their intent

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, Game is in Preview
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in 
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND media state is ON
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks Alexa for the following valid intent: i.e. "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname, or locale]."
AND a game is scheduled for today but has not yet begun (preview state)
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with: 
- The [awayTeam] vs. [homeTeam] game starts at [gameTime]. 


NOT PART OF PHASE 1
- Would you like to hear more information about the game?

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, Game is in Progress
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND media state is ON
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks Alexa for the following valid intent: i.e. "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname,  or locale]."
AND a game is currently in progress (live state)
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with a: "Playing the [team] [vs. or at] the [opponent] on [broadcast callsign]."
AND Game Audio Playback of live radio broadcast for the official English-language broadcaster of the team requested; usually the team's local broadcast network, but may be a national broadcaster such as MLB network.

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, Game is in Final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND media state is ON
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks Alexa for the following valid intent: i.e. "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname, or locale]."
AND a game has ended (final state) for today
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
- The [teamName] game already ended. The [teamName] [gameResult] to the [opponentName], [gameScore] in [inningTotal] innings.

NOT PART OF PHASE 1
- Would you like to hear more information about the game?

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, No game scheduled, time & opponent are available
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in 
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND media state is ON
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale
AND the team is NOT scheduled for a game today
AND time and opponent are available
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"There is no live [Team] broadcast right now. Tune in to their next game, [versus / at] the [Opponent], [Day of Week], [Month] [Date], at [First Pitch Time] [eastern / central / mountain / pacific]."

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, No game scheduled, no time is scheduled or is 3:33 AM ET, opponent is known
custom_preconds:
*3:33 AM ET, This happens when the game time is not yet scheduled. Usually when we have postseason games scheduled for specific days, but waiting on matchup for times; early this season, when we had WBC and exhibition matches unset (now all game times are set); also rescheduled / suspended games.

GIVEN the user has signed in 
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND media state is ON
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale
AND the team is NOT scheduled for a game today
AND no time is scheduled OR is scheduled for 3:33 AM ET
AND opponent is known
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
There is no live [Team] broadcast right now. Tune in to their next game, [versus / at] the [Opponent], [Day of Week], [Month] [Date], start time to be determined."

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, Team has No Live Broadcast
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the team has no live broadcast (no live broadcast for: pre-game, in progress, nor post-game state), but team has scheduled games for the current year's season or postseason
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team / Locale intent: "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname, or locale]."
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"There is no live [Team] broadcast right now. Tune in to their next game [versus / at] [Opponent], [Day of Week], [Month] [Date], at [First Pitch Time] [local time zone: eastern/central/mountain/pacific]."

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, Team has No Further Games Scheduled for the Regular Season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the team has no regular season games remaining
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team / Locale intent: "Ask M.L.B. to play the [team name, nickname, or locale].", i.e. Yankees
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with the club's first scheduled 20xx (where xx is next year) regular season game. 

i.e. 
'The Yankees' next game is at the Rays, Sunday, April 2nd, at 1:10PM eastern.'

i.e.

Not for phase 1:

title: Team/Nickname/Locale, intent not recognized, and User repeats intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team / Locale
AND the intent is not recognized
AND Alexa responds with: Sorry, I didn't recognize that. 

NOT FOR PHASE 1:
You can ask for scores, play radio broadcasts, or say 'help' for more options.
custom_steps:
WHEN the user reiterates a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale
AND Alexa recognized the intent this time
custom_expected: THEN Alexa responds accordingly with regards to the game status for today

title: Media Request, Playback Fails
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks Alexa for an valid media request
AND there is a problem with the broadcast's playback
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"Sorry, there was a problem playing the broadcast. Please try again later."

title: Cancel invalid request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks Alexa for an invalid request: i.e. "Ask M.L.B. to play the [invalid team name, nickname, or locale]."
AND 
Alexa responds with: "Sorry, I didn’t get that. What team did you want?"
custom_expected:
THEN the user replies with the intent: "Cancel"
AND Alexa responds with: "Thanks for using MLB."

title: No Access to Archived Media
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa for an media request of an archived broadcast
custom_expected: THEN the user is not able to access archived audio (user is only able to access live broadcasts of games in progress)

title: Continued Live Broadcast of Game when game is over
custom_preconds:
*In an ideal world, we’d cut off after the post-game show that many broadcasts use to fill the odd time left over from another scheduled show. But since we don’t know anything about the broadcast other than “game is final” and “media is still on”, we can’t really enforce that.

GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa for a broadcast of a live game
AND the game goes into Final
custom_expected: THEN the broadcast keeps on playing for a bit after the game is over

title: Device does not support streaming audio playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa for an media request of a broadcast
AND the device does not support streaming audio playback
custom_expected:
THEN prompted with the following:

"This device cannot play live game audio. To take full advantage of the MLB skill, we recommend you enable it on a streaming audio-capable Alexa device."

title: DO NOT TEST____EDIT Starter Info of Game not scheduled for today
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale
AND a game is not schedule for today
AND Alexa states: There is no [teamName] game today. The next game is [gameDate] at [gameTime] against the [opponentName].
AND the user asks if the Starters are know
AND Alexa states: Would you like to hear more information about that game?

Are these last two steps inverted? see the wiki: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/BAMbots/Amazon+Echo+-+Gameday+Audio?preview=/68289044/77173696/intent-media.png
custom_steps:
WHEN the user says either of the following replies:
- No
- Yes
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with

If reply is 'No':
- End ?????

If reply is 'Yes':
- The expected starting pitchers are [awayPitcherName] for the [awayTeam] and [homePitcherName] for the [homeTeam].
- [awayPitcherName] has a [eraValue] ERA this season. In his last [TBD] starts against the [homeTeam] he has an ERA of [eraValue].
- [homePitcherName] has [eraValue] ERA this season. In his last [TBD] starts against the [awayTeam] he has an ERA of [eraValue].

The [awayTeam] vs. [homeTeam] game starts at [gameTime].
Would you like to hear more information about that game?

WHEN the user gives either of the responses:
- No
- Yes

THEN Alexa responds with: 

If the user states 'No'
- End

If the user states 'Yes'
- The expected starting pitchers are [awayPitcherName] for the [awayTeam] and [homePitcherName] for the [homeTeam].
- [awayPitcherName] has a [eraValue] ERA this season. In his last [TBD] starts against the [homeTeam] he has an ERA of [eraValue].
- [homePitcherName] has a [eraVaue] ERA this season. In his last [TBD] starts against the [awayTeam] he has an ERA of [eraValue].

title: DO NOT TEST_____EDIT More Info of Game in Final, WrapBlurb
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup the client app, Alexa, and signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale of a game in final
AND Alexa responds with: 
- The [teamName] game already ended. The [teamName] [gameResult] to the [opponentName], [gameScore] in [inningTotal] innings.
- Would you like to hear more information about the game?
custom_steps:
WHEN the user replies with either of the following:
- No
- Yes
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with: 

If the user response was 'No':
- End?

If the user response was 'Yes' then the [wrapBlurb] is spoken:
- The winning pitcher was [winningPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningsPitched] innings, striking out [pitcherStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].
- The losing pitcher was [losingPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningPitched] innings, striking out [pitcherStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].

title: DO NOT TEST____EDIT Save Info of Game in Final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid Team, Nickname, or Locale of a game in final
AND Alexa responds with the game score
AND user says yes to hearing more game info
AND Alexa speaks the wrap blurb:  
The winning pitcher was [winningPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningsPitched] innings, striking out [pitcherStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks]. The losing pitcher was [losingPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningPitched] innings, striking out [pitcherStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks Alex about 'save?' and the result is either:
- No
- Yes
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with: 

If the results was 'No':
- The [winningTeam] had [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.
- The [losingTeam] had [runsScored] runs scores on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.

If the result was 'Yes':
- [saveEarner] collected his [saveNumber]st save of the season.
- The [winningTeam] had [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.
- The [losingTeam] had [runsScored] runs scores on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.

Both results state end, what does this mean?
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/BAMbots/Amazon+Echo+-+Gameday+Audio

title: Game Status Request, No game scheduled, Before 10:00 A.M. Flip Time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a valid game status intent: i.e. How did the A's do?
AND the team is NOT scheduled for a game today
AND the time is before the 10:00 AM flip
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
[dateRelative] the [teamName] [gameResult] the [opponentName], [gameScore].

title: EDIT Game Status Request, No game scheduled, After 10:00 A.M. Flip Time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription

custom_steps:

AND the team is NOT scheduled for a game today
AND the time is after the 10:00 AM flip time
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
The next [teamName] game is on [dateRelative] at [gameTime] at [venueName].

title: Game Status Request, Game in Preview, After 10:00 A.M. Flip Time, Preview Blurb Intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid game status intent: i.e. How did the A's do?
AND the team is scheduled for a game today & in preview state
AND the time is after the 10:00 AM flip time occurred
AND Alexa responds with: The next [teamName] game is on...
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a valid Preview blurb intent
custom_expected:
THEN 

If the preview blurb is know:
- Alexa speaks the Preview blurb

If the preview blurb is not know:
- the session is left open for user to speak an intent

title: Game Status Request, Game in Preview, After 10:00 A.M. Flip Time, Preview Blurb Not Known
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a valid game status intent: i.e. Are the A's losing?
AND the team is scheduled for a game today & in preview state
AND the time is after the 10:00 AM flip time occurred
AND the Preview blurb is NOT known
custom_expected: THEN user is able invoke Alexa with a starters known intent

title: Game Status Request, Game in Preview, After 10:00 A.M. Flip Time, Starters Known Intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa with a valid game status intent: i.e. How did the A's do?
AND the team is scheduled for a game today & in preview state
AND the time is after the 10:00 AM flip time occurred
AND the Preview blurb is known
AND Alexa responds with the Preview blurb
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a starters known intent
custom_expected:
THEN

if starters known, Alexa responds with:
"The expected starting pitchers are [awayPitcherName] for the [awayTeam] and [homePitcherName] for the [homeTeam].
"[awayPitcherName] has a [eraValue] ERA this season. In his last [TBD] starts against the [homeTeam] he hs an ERA of [eraValue].
"[homePitcherName] has a [eraValue] ERA this season. In his last [TBD] starts against the [awayTeam] he has asn ERA of [eraValue].

if starters not known:
- End

title: Game Status Request, Game In Progress
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN the user invokes Alexa for a game status intent: i.e. Did the A's win?
AND the game is in progress
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
"Here's the latest on the [teamName] game: the [teamName] [gameStatus] the [opponentName], [gameScore] in the [top/middle/bottom] of the [inningNumber] inning."

title: Game Status Request, Game In Progress, Mid-Inning
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa for a game request intent: i.e. How are the A's doing?
AND Alexa responds with the latest game update: Here's the latest on the [teamName] game...
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a mid-inning intent
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:

If in mid-inning:
The [teamName] due up next inning are [dueUp1], [dueUp2], [dueUp3].
The [awayTeam] has [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.
The [homeTeam] has [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.

If not in mid-inning:
[pitcherName] is currently pitching against [batterName] with [outsNumber] outs...

title: Game Status Request, Game In Progress, Mid-Inning, Men on Base
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa for a game request intent
AND Alexa responds with the latest game update: Here's the latest on the [teamName] game...
AND user invokes Alexa with a mid-inning intent
AND game is not in mid-inning
AND Alexa responds with game update: [pitcherName] is currently pitching...
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa with a men on base intent
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:
... and [baseRunnerValue] runners on base.
The [awayTeam] has [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.
The [homeTeam] has [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.

title: Game Status Request, Game In Final, Wrap Blurb Intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa for a game status intent: i.e. Did the A's win?
AND the game is in final
AND Alexa responds with: [dateRelative] the [teamName] [gameResult] the [opponentName], [gameScore].
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa for a wrap blurb intent
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:

If there is a wrap blurb available:
- Wrap Blurb
- The winning pitcher was [winningPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningsPitched] innings, striking out [pitcherStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].
- The losing pitcher was [losingPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningsPitched] innings, striking out [pitchersStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].

If no wrap blurb:
- The winning pitcher was [winningPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningsPitched] innings, striking out [pitcherStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].
- The losing pitcher was [losingPitcher], who allowed [runsAllowed] runs on [hitsAllowed] in [inningsPitched] innings, striking out [pitchersStrikeouts] and walking [pitcherWalks].

title: Game Status Request, Game In Final, Wrap Blurb Intent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has signed in
AND account is linked to MLB.com account with At Bat premium paid subscription
AND MLB skill has been opened
AND the user invokes Alexa for a game status intent: i.e. Did the A's win?
AND the game is in final
AND Alexa responds with: [dateRelative] the [teamName] [gameResult] the [opponentName], [gameScore].
AND user request wrap blurb intent
AND Alexa replies with wrap blurb (if available) & the winning & losing pitcher update
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes Alexa for a save intent
custom_expected:
THEN Alexa responds with:

If there is a save:
- [saveEarner] collected his [saveNumber]st save of the season.
- The [winningTeam] had [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.
- The [losingTeam] had [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorCommitted] errors.

If there is no save:
- The [winningTeam] had [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorsCommitted] errors.
- The [losingTeam] had [runsScored] runs scored on [hits] hits and committed [errorCommitted] errors.
